## Packages
```{r}
library(rcapso)
```

## Introduction
Unless otherwise specified all tests should be performed using a lattice size
of $512 \times 512$ cells.
```{r}
lattice_size <- 512 * 512
```

## Fig 6.9

### Requirements

1. The QtCaPso program.
2. The rcapso library.

### Procedure

1. Simulate a local CaPso model during 10000 seasons using the following
   parameters.
```json
{
    "competitionFactor": 0.1,
    "finalInertiaWeight": 0,
    "fitnessRadius": 10,
    "initialInertiaWeight": 0,
    "initialNumberOfPredators": 262,
    "initialNumberOfPreys": 1,
    "predatorCognitiveFactor": 0,
    "predatorMaximumSpeed": 0,
    "predatorReproductionRadius": 20,
    "predatorReproductiveCapacity": 2,
    "predatorSocialFactor": 0,
    "predatorSocialRadius": 1,
    "preyReproductionRadius": 20,
    "preyReproductiveCapacity": 1,
    "type": "LOCAL"
}
```

2. Repeat the previous step for a reproductive capacity of predators equal to
   3, 4, and 5.

3. Load the data in a data frame and normalize the densities of preys and
   predators.

```{r, read_fig_6_9_a_data}
path        <- "../../../../Datasets/capso/code_test/pcg_fig_6_9_a_"
batch_index <- "0"
sim_index   <- "0"

df_ez_2 <- read.csv(paste(path, batch_index, "_", sim_index, ".csv", sep = ""))
df_ez_2 <- df_ez_2[, c("Preys", "Predators")] / lattice_size
head(df_ez_2)
```

```{r}
path        <- "../../../../Datasets/capso/code_test/pcg_fig_6_9_b_"
batch_index <- "0"
sim_index   <- "0"

df_ez_3 <- read.csv(paste(path, batch_index, "_", sim_index, ".csv", sep = ""))
df_ez_3 <- df_ez_3[, c("Preys", "Predators")] / lattice_size
head(df_ez_3)
```

```{r}
path        <- "../../../../Datasets/capso/code_test/pcg_fig_6_9_c_"
batch_index <- "0"
sim_index   <- "0"

df_ez_4 <- read.csv(paste(path, batch_index, "_", sim_index, ".csv", sep = ""))
df_ez_4 <- df_ez_4[, c("Preys", "Predators")] / lattice_size
head(df_ez_4)
```

```{r}
path        <- "../../../../Datasets/capso/code_test/pcg_fig_6_9_d_"
batch_index <- "0"
sim_index   <- "0"

df_ez_5 <- read.csv(paste(path, batch_index, "_", sim_index, ".csv", sep = ""))
df_ez_5 <- df_ez_5[, c("Preys", "Predators")] / lattice_size
head(df_ez_5)
```

4. Generate matching data for all values of the reproductive capacity of
   predators using the mean field equations.

```{r}
mf_ez_2 <- rcapso_mean_field(use_reg = FALSE, num_iter = 1000,
                             psi0 = 1, phi0 = 0.001, alpha = 0.1,
                             ey = 1, ez = 2)
head(mf_ez_2)
```

```{r}
mf_ez_3 <- rcapso_mean_field(use_reg = FALSE, num_iter = 1000,
                             psi0 = 1, phi0 = 0.001, alpha = 0.1,
                             ey = 1, ez = 3)
head(mf_ez_3)
```

```{r}
mf_ez_4 <- rcapso_mean_field(use_reg = FALSE, num_iter = 1000,
                             psi0 = 1, phi0 = 0.001, alpha = 0.1,
                             ey = 1, ez = 4)
head(mf_ez_4)
```

```{r}
mf_ez_5 <- rcapso_mean_field(use_reg = FALSE, num_iter = 1000,
                             psi0 = 1, phi0 = 0.001, alpha = 0.1,
                             ey = 1, ez = 5)
head(mf_ez_5)
```

5. Now plot the phase plot of each dataset.

```{r, plot_fig_6_9_, fig.width = 8, fig.height = 9, dev = "svg"}
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))

plot(mf_ez_2[,  c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l", col = 4)
lines(df_ez_2[, c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l")

plot(df_ez_3[,  c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l")
lines(mf_ez_3[, c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l", col = 4)

plot(mf_ez_4[,  c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l", col = 4)
lines(df_ez_4[, c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l")

plot(mf_ez_5[,  c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l", col = 4)
lines(df_ez_5[, c("Preys", "Predators")], type = "l")
```

### Results

* Verify that each attractor matches the corresponding phase plot in Figure
  6.9.

## Fig 6.11

### Requirements

1. The QtCaPso program.
2. The rcapso library.

### Procedure

1. Simulate a local CaPso model during 100 seasons using the following
   parameters:
```json
{
    "competitionFactor": 0,
    "finalInertiaWeight": 0,
    "fitnessRadius": 1,
    "initialInertiaWeight": 0,
    "initialNumberOfPredators": 0,
    "initialNumberOfPreys": 9.999999747378752e-05,
    "predatorCognitiveFactor": 0,
    "predatorMaximumSpeed": 1,
    "predatorReproductionRadius": 1,
    "predatorReproductiveCapacity": 0,
    "predatorSocialFactor": 0,
    "predatorSocialRadius": 1,
    "preyReproductionRadius": 1,
    "preyReproductiveCapacity": 1,
    "type": "LOCAL"
}
```

2. Repeat the simulation with a `preyReproductiveCapacity` equal to `2` and
   `3`, load these data in a data frame.

```{r}
path          <- "../../../../Datasets/capso/code_test/pcg_fig_6_11_a_epsilon"
index         <- "23"

df            <- read.csv(paste(path, "_1_", index, ".csv", sep = ""))
br_ca_1       <- df[c("Preys", "PreyBirthRate")]
br_ca_1$Preys <- br_ca_1$Preys / lattice_size

df            <- read.csv(paste(path, "_2_", index, ".csv", sep = ""))
br_ca_2       <- df[c("Preys", "PreyBirthRate")]
br_ca_2$Preys <- br_ca_2$Preys / lattice_size

df            <- read.csv(paste(path, "_3_", index, ".csv", sep = ""))
br_ca_3       <- df[c("Preys", "PreyBirthRate")]
br_ca_3$Preys <- br_ca_3$Preys / lattice_size

head(br_ca_1)
```

3. Calculate the mean field growth rate of a population of preys for a
   reproductive capacity equal to 1, 2, and 3.

```{r}
prey_density <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 100)

br_1 <- rcapso_mean_field_growth_rate(prey_density, epsilon = 1, radius = 1)
br_2 <- rcapso_mean_field_growth_rate(prey_density, epsilon = 2, radius = 1)
br_3 <- rcapso_mean_field_growth_rate(prey_density, epsilon = 3, radius = 1)

br_mf <- data.frame(prey_density = prey_density, e_1_r_1 = br_1,
                    e_2_r_1 = br_2, e_3_r_1 = br_3)

head(br_mf)
```

4. Plot the birth rate of preys obtained in the simulations next to the mean
   field birth rate.

```{r echo=TRUE, fig.width=10, fig.height=6, dev = "svg"}
par(mfrow = c(1, 2))

plot(br_mf$prey_density,  br_mf$e_3_r_1, type = "l", col = 2, lwd = 3,
    xlab = "Prey density", ylab = "Prey birth rate")
lines(br_mf$prey_density, br_mf$e_2_r_1, type = "l", col = 3, lwd = 3)
lines(br_mf$prey_density, br_mf$e_1_r_1, type = "l", col = 4, lwd = 3)

grid(lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 1)

plot(br_ca_3$Preys,  br_ca_3$PreyBirthRate, type = "l", col = 2, lwd = 3,
    xlab = "Prey density", ylab = "Prey birth rate")
lines(br_ca_2$Preys, br_ca_2$PreyBirthRate, type = "l", col = 3, lwd = 3)
lines(br_ca_1$Preys, br_ca_1$PreyBirthRate, type = "l", col = 4, lwd = 3)

grid(lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 1)
```

### Results

* Verify that the functional form of the mean field data is similar to the
  functional form obtained in the simulations.
* Verity that the scale of the curves of the simulations matches the scale in
  Figure 6.11.a.
